instructions: Soak dried chickpeas in plenty of water overnight or for at least 8 hours.
Drain and rinse the soaked chickpeas.
In a food processor, combine chickpeas, onion, garlic, parsley, cilantro, coriander powder, cumin powder, salt, and black pepper. Pulse until a coarse mixture forms.
Transfer the mixture to a bowl and stir in baking soda and 2 tablespoons of flour. If the mixture is too wet, add more flour, one tablespoon at a time, until the mixture can be formed into balls.
Cover the bowl and refrigerate for 1 hour to help the mixture firm up.
Shape the mixture into small balls or patties.
In a deep frying pan, heat vegetable oil over medium heat until it reaches 350°F (175°C).
Fry falafel balls or patties in batches for 3-5 minutes or until golden brown. Be careful not to overcrowd the pan.
Remove falafel from the oil using a slotted spoon and place them on a plate lined with paper towels to drain excess oil.

Serve falafel hot with your favorite toppings, such as tahini sauce, hummus, or tomatoes, lettuce, and onions.
